snippet:
LivingSocial, the daily deals site, told its employees Friday that it had been breached, and said that data for 50 million users might have been compromised.
   
In a memo to employees, the company, based in Washington, said online crimina...

headline.main: LivingSocial Hack Exposes Data for 50 Million Users

snippet:
J. C. Penney  doesn’t have many fans on Wall Street. But a big one emerged on Thursday:  George Soros .
   
Mr. Soros, the hedge fund billionaire, on Thursday disclosed a 7.9 percent stake in Penney, with 17.4 million shares, accord...
abstract: Hedge fund billionaire George Soros discloses 7.9 percent stake in J C Penney, or 17.4 million shares; Soros will not use stake to exert influence on embattled retailer. (M)

headline.main: Billionaire Investor Soros Buys a 7.9% Stake in J.C. Penney

snippet: Sheik Mohammed bin Rashid al-Maktoum of Dubai, and Godolphin, his global horse racing enterprise, have been the talk of Britain after 11 of his best horses tested positive for banned steroids.
abstract: Sheik Mohammed bin Rashid al-Maktoum of Dubai, and Godolphin, his global horse racing enterprise, have become talk of Britain after 11 of his best horses tested positive for banned steroids; Godolphin has locked down its Moulton Paddocks facility in England.

headline.main: A Blow to British Horse Racing

snippet: Jonathan Winters was in no known comic tradition, in no familiar style, in no pre-existing category of humor.
abstract: Jonathan Winters was in no known comic tradition, in no familiar style, in no pre-existing category of humor.

headline.main: With Winters Gone, Can We Be Far Behind?

snippet: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. For Friday, selections include a State Department employee with a major reputation as an online gamer, the ferocious competition for tickets...
abstract: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. For Friday, selections include a State Department employee with a major reputation as an online gamer, the ferocious competition for tickets to an Apple conference, and the new Tumblr site from the White House.

headline.main: Today's Scuttlebot: Attack Video and Bell's Voice

snippet: The daily deals site said it had been hit by a cyberattack that may have left usernames, e-mail addresses, dates of birth and encrypted passwords for 50 million users vulnerable.
abstract: The daily deals site said it had been hit by a cyberattack that may have left usernames, e-mail addresses, dates of birth and encrypted passwords for 50 million users vulnerable.

headline.main: LivingSocial Hack Exposes Data for 50 Million Customers
headline.print_headline: LivingSocial Hack Exposes Data for 50 Million Users

snippet: Samsung plans to open a new digital content store, but some some analysts say it’s far from certain that the company’s store will pose a serious challenge to those run by Apple, Amazon and Google.
abstract: Samsung plans to open a new digital content store, but some some analysts say it’s far from certain that the company’s store will pose a serious challenge to those run by Apple, Amazon and Google.

headline.main: An Uncertain Lure for Samsung's Digital Store

byline.original: By CLAIRE CAIN MILLER and BRIAN X. CHEN

snippet: The smartphone has finally surpassed the traditional feature phone, also known as the dumb phone, in sales worldwide. Samsung Electronics is leading the pack.
abstract: The smartphone has finally surpassed the traditional feature phone, also known as the dumb phone, in sales worldwide. Samsung Electronics is leading the pack.

headline.main: Smartphones Finally Surpass the Feature Phone

snippet: The economy trudged in the first quarter. While corporate earnings were strong, they were at times coupled with declines in revenue.
abstract: Stocks stall as United States reports disappointing figures for first-quarter growth and handful of large companies post tepid earnings.

headline.main: Shares Close Mixed on Tepid Growth and Earnings
headline.print_headline: Shares Close Mixed on Tepid Growth and Earnings

snippet: The hedge fund manager Warren G. Lichtenstein is fighting with Andrew Cader, a former Goldman Sachs executive, over a British socialite’s child support claims. | George Soros disclosed a 7.9 percent stake in J.C. Penney, a retailer without many fa...
abstract: The hedge fund manager Warren G. Lichtenstein is fighting with Andrew Cader, a former Goldman Sachs executive, over a British socialite’s child support claims. | George Soros disclosed a 7.9 percent stake in J.C. Penney, a retailer without many fans on Wall Street. | Two senators introducing a new banking bill can be thought of as punk rockers. | Though they’re now allowed to tweet, companies are being cautious.

headline.main: Millionaires in a Legal Skirmish Over Child Support
